alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Johnston; Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 1:51PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN SAMPSON...EASTERN CUMBERLAND AND SOUTH CENTRAL JOHNSTON COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 151 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Godwin to 9 miles east of Fayetteville to near Duart. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Godwin, Eastover, Roseboro, Stedman, Newton Grove, Wade, Salemburg, Falcon, Autryville, and Linden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
